Sentencas: Ferritic stainless steels are candidate interconnect materials for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC); however, the oxidation resistance of commercial stainless steels within the operating temperature range of 700-800 degrees C is not adequate.
Titulo: The effect of surface treatment on the oxidation of ferritic stainless steels used for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: A relatively thick, poorly conducting oxide layer forms on the surface of the stainless steel interconnect, decreasing cell performance.
Titulo: The effect of surface treatment on the oxidation of ferritic stainless steels used for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: One way of modifying the oxidation behaviour of an alloy is through surface treatment.
Titulo: The effect of surface treatment on the oxidation of ferritic stainless steels used for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: The aim of this work is to perform a systematic study of the effect of surface treatment (sandblasting and cold rolling) on the oxidation behaviour of three different ferritic stainless steels at 800 degrees C in air.
Titulo: The effect of surface treatment on the oxidation of ferritic stainless steels used for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: Oxidized specimens are characterized using X-ray diffraction (XRD) and scanning electron microscopy (SEM).
Titulo: The effect of surface treatment on the oxidation of ferritic stainless steels used for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: In addition, specimens oxidized under the same conditions for 15 min are examined using secondary ion mass spectrometry (SIMS) depth profiling and X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) depth profiling.
Titulo: The effect of surface treatment on the oxidation of ferritic stainless steels used for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: For all three steels, the as-is (undeformed) specimens have a lower mass gain than the deformed specimens.
Titulo: The effect of surface treatment on the oxidation of ferritic stainless steels used for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: The steel with the highest Cr content has significantly higher mass gains than the other two steels, which have similar mass gains.
Titulo: The effect of surface treatment on the oxidation of ferritic stainless steels used for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: X-ray diffraction and electron microscopy results indicate that the oxide scale formed on all the specimens consists of an inner layer of chromia and an outer spinel layer.
Titulo: The effect of surface treatment on the oxidation of ferritic stainless steels used for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: The relative amounts of the two oxide phases present depends on both the steel and treatment condition.
Titulo: The effect of surface treatment on the oxidation of ferritic stainless steels used for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: The presence of insulating oxides at the metal/oxide interface is detected with both surface science techniques and electron microscopy.
Titulo: The effect of surface treatment on the oxidation of ferritic stainless steels used for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects
